snippet: President Obama’s request for Congress to provide $3.7 billion to confront a surge of migrants crossing the border into Texas quickly became entangled in the fierce debate over immigration.
abstract: Pres Obama urges Congress to provide almost $4 billion to confront a flood of almost 52,000 young migrants crossing border from Central America into Texas; says sudden surge has overwhelmed local resources and money is needed for new detention facilities, surveillance and to hire more border officials; Republicans are wary of request and criticize Obama for what they call his failure to secure border after years of illegal crossings.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s request for Congress to provide $3.7 billion to confront a surge of migrants crossing the border into Texas quickly became entangled in the fierce debate over immigration.

headline.main: Obama Asks for $3.7 Billion to Aid Border
